intro: Rhus krebsiana, commonly known as the Mexican sumac, is a shrub or small tree native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Anacardiaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like poison ivy and mango. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves, which are often arranged in pairs and have a serrated edge. Its small, yellowish-green flowers are clustered in panicles, and it produces red, fuzzy berries that are a food source for various birds and animals. Rhus krebsiana is often found in dry, rocky soils and can thrive in arid environments.
